meanings.definition: A drop of salty liquid that comes out of your eye when you cry.
meanings.sent1: She wiped away a tear from her cheek.
meanings.sent2: The sad movie made her tear up.
meanings.sent3: The clown's funny antics brought a tear to her eye.
meanings.sent4: His heartfelt speech touched a tear in everyone's eye.
meanings.sent5: The tear rolled down her face, leaving a trail of sadness.

meanings.definition: To pull or rip something apart.
meanings.sent1: She had to tear the paper to make it fit.
meanings.sent2: He used all his strength to tear the fabric.
meanings.sent3: The strong wind threatened to tear the flag.
meanings.sent4: The news of the accident will tear her heart.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the engine made him tear his hair in frustration.

meanings.definition: A hole or split in something caused by it being pulled apart forcefully.
meanings.sent1: The tear in her dress was easily mended.
meanings.sent2: The tear in the painting was carefully restored.
meanings.sent3: The tear in the curtain let in a sliver of light.
meanings.sent4: The tear in the fabric revealed a glimpse of the pattern beneath.
meanings.sent5: The tear in the book's page made it difficult to read the next line.
